_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan- Executive Summary

Carson Grain Company, Troy Mills Iowa
Contact Jay Carson
Phone: (319)-224-3296

1. Facility Policy.

The owners of Carson Grain are commited to the prevention of any accidental release of Anhydrous Ammonia.  If a release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local authorities to mitigate and minimixe the impact of the release to people and environment.

Worst case scenario 80000 lbs per min in 10 min period of NH3 resulting in a vapor and liquid release.  this could effect 1762 residents in an endpoint of 5.1 miles according to EPA's RMP Comp (TM) calculations. This is the failure of one (1)18,000 gallon storage tank when fille dto the greatest amount allowed (85%  capacity, resulting in the release of the total volume in a gaseous (hazardous ammonia vapor cloud) form.    

The alternative release scenerio involves the transoprt delivery vehicle pulling away from the intake lines into the storage plant wthout disconnecting the transfer hoses.  The resulting release, according to EPA's RMP*Comp Program has a distance of .7 miles.

This facility complies with state and local codes and regulations for Anhydrous Ammonia storage.  Our facility is inspected twice a year by a State of Iowa inspector.

This facility is an ag retail business and we store anhydrous ammonia for retail to farmer customers.  Our storage consists of 1-18000 gallon  tank and 15 small tanks with associates pumps, compressors and plumbing.

Our facility has never had an accident.   Excess flow valves on the lines are present for active mitigation in this analysis as they function to close whem maximum allowable flow conditions exist.

This facility's prevention programs are the elements of OSHA's Process Safety Management Program.  These concepts include: employee participation, analysis of hazards, operation procedures and safe work practices, Personnel training and maintenance.

in the event of an emergency  involving our anhydrous ammonia

system, it is the policy of Carson Grain to notify the Troy mills Fire Department and the LEPC requesting assistance.  In the event of an accident, immediate emergency response measures will be implemented.

We have no planned changes at this time
